member.name: M:JJ.Framework.Text.StringExtensions.FromTill(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Takes the middle of a string by specifying the 0-based start index and the end index.

member.name: M:JJ.Framework.Text.StringExtensions.Left(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the left part of a string. Throws an exception if the string has less characters than the length provided.

member.name: M:JJ.Framework.Text.StringExtensions.RemoveExcessiveWhiteSpace(System.String)

member.summary: Variation on String.Replace with the ability to ignore case.

member.name: M:JJ.Framework.Text.StringExtensions.TakeEnd(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the right part of a string. Can return less characters than the length provided, if string is shorter.

member.name: M:JJ.Framework.Text.StringExtensions.TrimEnd(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Will trim off repetitions of the same value from the given string. These are variations of the standard .NET methods that instead of just taking char[] can take a string or a length.

member.name: M:JJ.Framework.Text.StringExtensions_Casing.StartWithCap(System.String)
member.summary: Turns the first character into a capital letter.

member.name: M:JJ.Framework.Text.StringExtensions_Casing.ToCamelCase(System.String)
member.summary: Converts e.g. "This is a sentence." to "thisIsASentence" so it can be used in code. A little more restrictive than actual C# camel case. Only latin accent-free characters, digits and _ will be kept in tact. Other characters will be escaped in the form "u" + hex unicode character code. This clashes with for instance a literal "u0021", so it is not a full-proof way to generate a unique result.

member.name: M:JJ.Framework.Text.StringHelper.Join(System.Char,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Object})
member.summary: Alternative for String.Join, that takes a char as a separator.
